tasks.task: Setting up a drip irrigation system
subtasks: Identifying components of the system
Connecting the system to a water hose faucet
Installing a battery timer
Adapting the system for various garden types (vegetable garden, raised bed, containers)

tasks.task: Modifying the drip irrigation setup for different environments
subtasks: Disassembling the system for transport or adaptation
Connecting the system to different water sources as needed
Customizing the timer settings for specific plant needs
Ensuring proper water distribution across garden beds
Understanding the various parts needed for drip irrigation.
Setting up the initial water source for the irrigation system.
Controlling the watering schedule without needing electricity.
Ensuring the drip irrigation setup is suitable for different environments such as vegetable gardens, raised beds, and containers.
- Disassembling the system for transport or adaptation (SUBTASK).
- Connecting the system to different water sources as needed (SUBTASK).
- Customizing timer settings for specific plant needs (SUBTASK).
- Ensuring proper water distribution across garden beds (SUBTASK).
